channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un ready to talk if U.S. drops denuclearization demand
item.description: Kim told North Korea's legislature he's ready to resume talks, adding he had "good memories" of President Trump, despite ongoing tension over Washingt...

item.title: Rheumatoid arthritis kept her captive. This nerve stimulator set her free.
item.description: A new surgically implanted device the size of a lima bean can help control rheumatoid arthritis that isn't responding to drugs.

item.title: What to know as U.N. General Assembly opens, marking 80 years, tackling deep crises
item.description: This year the United Nations is marking its 80th anniversary, but diplomats don't have much to celebrate.

item.title: The evangelical Christian faith on display at Kirk's memorial shaped his politics
item.description: Charlie Kirk's evangelical faith was on display at his memorial, where supporters remembered him as a "martyr." Christianity shaped Kirk's politics an...

item.title: This small Virginia island could be underwater before the next century
item.description: Tangier Island in Virginia — one of the last inhabited islands in the Chesapeake Bay — is under threat from rising sea levels and climate change.

item.title: Charlie Kirk memorial service honors conservative activist
item.description: President Trump, Vice President JD Vance and Erika Kirk spoke at Sunday's memorial service for Charlie Kirk, founder of Turning Point USA.

item.title: 9/21/2025: Disrupter U.; Sculpting Evolution; Flight of the Monarchs
item.description: First, a look at UATX: the college advocating for free speech. Then, a report on mouse DNA and the fight against Lyme disease. And, inside the monarch...

item.title: Super typhoon hits Philippines as thousands evacuate
item.description: Ragasa has hit northern Philippines and is barrelling towards southern China.

item.title: 'I'm Kenyan, don't shoot' - the athlete who says he was duped into the Russian army
item.description: Evans Kibet, now being held in Ukraine after surrendering, says he did not know he was signing up.

item.title: Loopholes in hospital charity care programs stick patients with bills
item.description: Even if people qualify for financial help with their hospital bills, the care they receive may not be covered.

item.title: South Korea would accept a Trump-Kim deal to freeze nuclear programme, president tells BBC
item.description: Lee Jae Myung tells the BBC he wants to restore trust with North Korea.

item.title: EU cyber agency says airport software held to ransom by criminals
item.description: Brussels Airport asks airlines to cancel nearly half of their outgoing flights on Monday.

item.title: Botswana declares public holiday after 'historic' athletics gold medal
item.description: President Duma Boko congratulates the men's 4x400m relay team for winning gold at the World Athletic Championships.

item.title: Tourist mistaken for wanted fugitive spends nearly a month in prison
item.description: The tourist found out he shares a name with a wanted criminal, previously sentenced to two years in prison in Italy for aggravated theft.

item.title: 9/21: Sunday Morning
item.description: Hosted by Jane Pauley. Featured: A new mural for St. Patrick’s Cathedral; Priscilla Presley on her memoir about life after Elvis; actor Dwayne Johnson...

item.title: Patrons at New Hampshire restaurant shooting prevented worse tragedy with selfless acts, AG says
Trump officials praise Charlie Kirk’s faith and his mark on the conservative movement
Trump ramps up retribution campaign with push for Bondi to pursue cases against his foes
item.description: Eight months into his second term, President Donald Trump’s long-standing pledge to take on those he perceives as his political enemies has prompted d...
